an ancient Greek scientist who studied and taught medicine: The Hippocratic oath is based on the ideals of Hippocrates, a Greek physician.
More examplesFewer examplesIn 360 BC, Hippocrates , the father of medicine, wrote about scurvy.From two to three thousand years ago, fatal malaria was described in Homer's Iliad, and then in the writings of Plato, Aristotle and Hippocrates.In ancient Greece, Hippocrates recorded tuberculosis as the most widespread disease and almost always fatal.Hippocrates called olive oil the "great therapeutic".
